abstract.text: A virtual camera for defining the appearance of the map.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A camera object defines a virtual viewpoint above the map surface and affects how MapKit presents the map to the user. You use a camera object to specify the location of the camera on the map, the compass heading indicating the camera’s viewing direction, the pitch of the camera relative to the map perpendicular, and the camera’s altitude above the map. These factors create a map view with a three-dimensional perspective.

After creating an instance of this class, configure it with the desired attributes and assign it to your map view. When you assign a camera to your map view, MapKit centers the map using the value in your camera object’s

property, updating the map’s own region information in the process. The map also takes the camera’s pitch and altitude into account when calculating the visible region, ensuring that the region encompasses the visible content on the map.

abstract.text: Display map or satellite imagery within your app, call out points of interest, and determine placemark information for map coordinates.
A specialized view that displays the compass heading for its associated map.
A virtual camera for defining the appearance of the map.
The altitude above the ground, in meters.
Returns a new camera object for you to configure.
The map coordinate at the center of the map view.
The distance from the center point of the map to the camera, in meters.
The heading of the camera (in degrees) relative to true north.
Returns a new camera object using the specified map item, view size, and pitch.
Returns a new camera object using the specified distance, pitch, and heading information.
Returns a new camera object using the specified viewing angle information.
The viewing angle of the camera, in degrees.
A specialized view that displays and controls the pitch angle of the map view.
A specialized view that displays the scale information for its associated map.
A specialized bar button item that allows the user to toggle whether the map tracks to the heading the user is facing.
A specialized button that allows the user to toggle whether the map tracks to the heading the user is facing.
A specialized view that displays and controls the zoom level of the map view.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
